thread.title: Facebook to team up with Eutelsat to beam free Internet to sub-Saharan Africa
thread.title_full: Facebook to team up with Eutelsat to beam free Internet to sub-Saharan Africa - MarketWatch

author: Ciara Linnane
title: Facebook to team up with Eutelsat to beam free Internet to sub-Saharan Africa
text:
Facebook Inc. said Monday it is planning a partnership with French satellite operator Eutelsat Communications SA ETL, +0.32% to beam free Internet coverage to parts of sub-Saharan Africa.
The companies are planning to use the broadband payload of the future AMOS-6 satellite and build a dedicated system of gateways and terminals to bring the Web to the many Africans who currently have no access.
For Facebook FB, +2.11% the move is part of its Internet.org initiative launched two years ago that aims to speed up the rate of connectivity by finding ways to overcome the physical, economic and social barriers that keep people from getting online.
“Facebook’s mission is to connect the world and we believe that satellites will play an important role in addressing the significant barriers that exist in connecting the people of Africa,” said Chris Daniels, VP of Internet.org.
As the chart below illustrates, Africa remains one of the most underserved markets for Internet access in the world. The data was curated by FindTheCompany.com and sourced from FinancialContent, Zacks Investment Research and Quandl. It is fully interactive: Just hold your cursor over the map to get numbers for individual countries.
The next chart shows Facebook’s quarterly research & development spending, which has grown rapidly to more than $1.0 billion in the second quarter.
The final chart shows Facebook stock’s movement over time.
